categories.name: Drying Alcohols
categories.description: Short-chain alcohols considered drying because they evaporate quickly and can strip natural oils from the hair and scalp

categories.description: Parabens are preservatives commonly used in cosmetic products to prevent bacterial growth

categories.name: Sulfates
categories.description: Sulfates are cleansing agents that create lather and remove oil and dirt

categories.name: Emollient alcohols
categories.description: These are long-chain fatty alcohols that help to soften and moisturize hair

categories.name: Water-soluble Silicones
categories.description: Water-soluble silicones in hair care products are a type of silicone that is easily washed out of the hair with regular shampoo

references.title: Silicone Polymers in Skin Care

categories.name: Non-water-soluble Silicones
categories.description: Non-water-soluble silicones in hair care products are a type of silicone that cannot be easily washed out with gentle shampoos or cowash

categories.name: Other Oils
categories.description: These are other oils that don't fit into the other categories

categories.name: Other Anionic Surfactants
categories.description: Like sulfates, these are anionic surfactants, which means they have a negative charge and are good at removing oil and dirt from the hair

categories.name: Astringents
categories.description: Astringents in hair care are substances that tighten pores and reduce oil production on the scalp

categories.name: Soaps
categories.description: Soaps are cleansers made from fatty acids and alkali metals

references.title: Evaluation of pH of Bathing Soaps and Shampoos for Skin and Hair Care
USGS: Why does it take so long to rinse soap off my hands? What are hard water and soft water?
Skin Cleansing without or with Compromise: Soaps and Syndets

categories.name: Mild surfactants
categories.description: These surfactants are typically amphoteric, cationic, or non-ionic and are considered to be gentler on the hair and scalp than anionic surfactants like sulfates

categories.name: Heavy Oils and Butters
categories.description: These oils and butters are can penetrate (soak into) the hair shaft

categories.name: Light Oils
categories.description: Light oils have a low ability to penetrate (soak into) the hair shaft

categories.name: Medium Oils
categories.description: Medium oils have a moderate ability to penetrate (soak into) the hair shaft

categories.name: Non-water-soluble Waxes
categories.description: Non-water-soluble waxes are waxes that are not easily washed out from hair

categories.name: Water-soluble Waxes
categories.description: Water-soluble waxes are waxes that are easily washed out from hair

categories.name: Evaporative Silicones
categories.description: Evaporative silicones are lightweight silicones that evaporate quickly, leaving no residue

categories.name: Other
categories.description: These are other ingredients that don't fit into the other categories

categories.name: Solvents
categories.description: Solvents are substances that dissolve other substances

categories.name: Polyquats
categories.description: Polyquats are positively charged polymers used in haircare products to condition, detangle, and add shine by forming a protective film around the hair shaft.

categories.name: Petroleum Oils
categories.description: These are petroleum based ingredients that are often avoided for their build up potential as well as their petro-based origin.

categories.name: Film Forming Humectants
categories.description: These are large, complex molecules that may be better at retaining moisture in low humidity conditions

categories.name: Simple Humectants
categories.description: These lightweight humectants may perform poorly in low humidity conditions

categories.name: Proteins
categories.description: Proteins in hair care products can help strengthen and repair hair, but some people find them drying

categories.name: Other Preservatives
categories.description: These are other preservatives that don't fit into the other categories

categories.name: Other Emollients
categories.description: These are other emollients that don't fit into the other categories

categories.name: Conditioning Agents
categories.description: These are conditioning agents that don't fit into the other categories

categories.name: Film Forming Agents
categories.description: These ingredients form a thin invisible layer on the hair to hold style, prevent moisture loss, and protect from damage.
